page.title: 04Local History (C)
page.content: In 1941 Cardross was bombed by German bombers. On one night 400 explosive and 2000 incendiary bombs were dropped on this tiny village. One of the buildings that was worst hit was the old Parish Church. Lots of Cardross people tried to put out the fires. One bomb came through the roof and fell behind the organ; nobody could get at it. As the flames went through the organ pipes, great whooshing noises were heard. The church was destroyed and now only a ruin remains as a reminder of that night. The rest of the village was badly bombed , the golf club house was destroyed, even the animals in the fields were slaughtered. The most probable theory on the bombing is that Cardross was mistaken for Bowling, where there were large petrol storage tanks.
